Trump defends Saudi prince over journalist's murder, woos him with lavish welcome
subhead: The Saudi royal, who came bearing a pledge of a $1 trillion investment in the US on his first visit since the 2018 killing, said journalist Jamal Khashoggi's murder was 'painful' and a 'huge mistake.' The White House later announced a deal on the sale of US F-35 warplanes.

title: How Libya has become a regional hub for fuel smuggling
subhead: The massive diversion of subsidized petroleum products is fueling instability around Libya's borders, particularly with Sudan, according to a report by the American NGO The Sentry.

title: Silvère Jarrosson, a dancer turned painter at the intersection of art and science
subhead: The artist, who exhibited eight paintings in the Grande Galerie de l'Évolution natural museum in Paris, draws on a scientific approach to recreate the generative processes of natural forms on canvas.

'No one ever called us': Retired French police officer stunned to learn of daughter's death online, three months after burial
subhead: Jean Forest discovered this summer that his daughter Marjolaine, a university scholar, had been buried in the spring. He investigated why his family was not informed and denounces the administrative and social indifference he encountered.

title: Salah Abdeslam: The prisoner who will never disappear, 10 years after Paris attacks
subhead: Despite the charges recently brought against the sole surviving member of the November 2015 attack teams for possessing a USB drive that allegedly allowed him to access jihadist propaganda in his prison cell, his lawyers and those close to him paint the picture of a man who had made positive progress in recent years.

title: London's 'mudlarks' scour the Thames for treasure
subhead: On the banks of the British capital's river, London's 'mudlarks' search for fragments of the past: ancient pottery, old coins, bone dice. These enthusiasts are less motivated by the value of the objects than by the stories they tell. Sometimes, their finds even end up in a museum, as is currently being shown in an exhibition at the London Museum.
